enrich_metadata.abstract: San Juan Capistrano (/sæn ˌwɑːn kæpᵻˈstrɑːnoʊ/; [saŋ ˈxwaŋ kapisˈtɾano]) is a city in Orange County, California, United States. The current OMB metropolitan designation for San Juan Capistrano and the Orange County Area is "Santa Ana-Anaheim-Irvine, CA." The population was 34,593 at the 2010 census, up from 33,826 at the 2000 census. The city was created around Mission San Juan Capistrano, and many of the homes and strip malls resemble the Spanish architecture that composes the building. It is home to the widest variety of homes in Orange County, including those built prior to 1900 in its central district (some being adobes from the 18th century). San Juan Capistrano formerly hosted a population of cliff swallows that migrate each year from Argentina to the Mission San Juan Capistrano.

enrich_metadata.mention_address: San Diego, San Diego County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.label: San Diego
enrich_metadata.comment: San Diego /ˌsæn diːˈeɪɡoʊ/ (Spanish for "Saint Didacus") is a major city in California, on the coast of the Pacific Ocean in Southern California, approximately 120 miles (190 km) south of Los Angeles and immediately adjacent to the border with Mexico.
enrich_metadata.abstract: San Diego /ˌsæn diːˈeɪɡoʊ/ (Spanish for "Saint Didacus") is a major city in California, on the coast of the Pacific Ocean in Southern California, approximately 120 miles (190 km) south of Los Angeles and immediately adjacent to the border with Mexico. With an estimated population of 1,381,069 as of July 1, 2014, San Diego is the eighth-largest city in the United States and second-largest in California. San Diego is the birthplace of California and is known for its mild year-round climate, natural deep-water harbor, extensive beaches, long association with the U.S. Navy, and recent emergence as a healthcare and biotechnology development center. Historically home to the Kumeyaay people, San Diego was the first site visited by Europeans on what is now the West Coast of the United States. Upon landing in San Diego Bay in 1542, Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo claimed the entire area for Spain, forming the basis for the settlement of Alta California 200 years later. The Presidio and Mission of San Diego, founded in 1769, formed the first European settlement in what is now California. In 1821, San Diego became part of newly independent Mexico, and in 1850, became part of the United States following the Mexican–American War and the admission of California to the union. The city is the seat of San Diego County and is the economic center of the region as well as the San Diego–Tijuana metropolitan area. San Diego's main economic engines are military and defense-related activities, tourism, international trade, and manufacturing. The presence of the University of California, San Diego (UCSD), with the affiliated UCSD Medical Center, has helped make the area a center of research in biotechnology.

enrich_metadata.mention_address: Beverly Hills, Los Angeles County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.label: Beverly Hills, California
enrich_metadata.comment: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.
enrich_metadata.abstract: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Beverly_Hills,_California

We love to take our morning walks here and then stop for coffee and breakfast bagels. We sit outside with all the other walkers and enjoy the sun and view. Perfect! Try "Pat's... read more
I remember before they built the harbor, so I am a bit biased here, since I prefer the original. My inlaws have a view of the harbor and it is a very nice view, especially to see... read more
This is real nice to walk around on a romantic afternoon out. There's an area to drink your coffee or have an ice cream. There's also a cute little gift shop. The jetty is... read more
small town feel on the water. great for walks. restaurants, boutique shops.
We used the electric hoist launch from dry boat storage. I watched the people at the trailer launch area and didn't see any problems.
Lots to do here. The beach, just walking along the Marina, a lot of restaurants, the Ocean Institute, picnic areas, people watching galore.
Incredible place to visit. We walked the harbor, visited restaurants, shops and bars. Our driving was down to a minimum. We loved the shops, the places to eat and scene. We... read more
Very nice for walking and taking in the sites. Several places to choose from to eat but so far all food has been OK, not really good.
The harbor had a very nice shallow beach for swimming with kids., Paddle boats, kayak and sailing lessons were available all at a very reasonable price. it was lots of fun and... read more
Very relaxing area. Long pathways to walk to and fro on. The restaurants are tasty and reasonably priced.
A good place to visit in the evening for a gentle walk and very good choice of restaurants and boutique shops. Lots of free parking, and some nice views.
So many sights to see in the harbor. From the Ocean Institute to all the restaurants and shops. This is a great place for everyone.
We love the Harbor Deli and the Dana Point Wharf Whale Watching Boat. Huge, delicious sandwiches at the deli, yummy pickles, and sweet waitresses. The whale watching staff is... read more
This is a very pretty area to visit any time of the day, but I especially enjoy it in the fall or early winter as the sun is setting. There is a parade of lights that takes place... read more
Lovely to stroll around, quaint stores. Very clean, you can go out on a boat to watch the dolphins. Choice of food establishments was very good.
The harbor with it's shops and restaurants, parks, nearby beaches and tidepools and Marine Institute is a perfect pace to enjoy a day/weekend or longer. It's quiet during the week... read more
We didn't own a boat but went there for dinner. Plenty of places to eat. You looked at the marina and imagined a boat of tourists leaving for a "3 hour tour."
This was a great destination when we visited the area for a conference, there are shops and restaurants, and piers to walk out onto. I really enjoyed seeing the local animals... read more
This is a wonderful place to drop by to walk the shore and to view the activities in the harbor, as well as to cool down when the temperatures get too high in the summer. The... read more
Love this area. Lived here for almost 30 years. The park is a great way to escape the heat. Great people watching, boat watching and general "chillaxin". Laguna can get really... read more
The best time to visit Dana Point is at the time of a festival or at Christmas. It is a wonderful place to look at ships and boats, get a meal and just generally mess around. At... read more
Love coming here. The whale watching companies are great. Lots of great shops and many good places to eat.
I love it here. Dana Point Harbor is not nearly as crowded or snooty as many SoCal harbors. The boats are lovely, the area is well maintained, and there are plenty of benches to... read more
Dana Point Harbor is a gem tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the Pacific Coast Highway. At the very end is the Ocean Institute with programs for adults and kids. There's... read more
Great walking trails, shops, restaurants, boat rentals and transportation to Catalina Island. You need to drive around to find free parking.
The Harbor was relaxing and so peaceful after a long day of sighting and sun. We went there every night to meet people and have ice cream or coffee to unwind. Love looking out at... read more
Very good Restaurants. lots of souvenir shops. Saw sea lions in the harbor water. Very short walk from the Marriott Dana Point.
Between walking along the very scenic walkways and enjoying the boats, the views of the harbor, and the shops and restaurants, you can lose track of time! A great place to spend... read more

The Dana Point Harbor is a nice place to take pictures. There are a few shops and restaurants. Very enjoyable outing.
Recommend the whale watching excursions. We saw blue whales, hump back whales and tons of dolphins. Make sure to take advantage of the 2 for Tuesdays tickets.
Very pretty, very busy with people and boats and restaurants. There was lots of activity from people paddling, to people painting on the beach, to people surfing and people just... read more
We had a blast at D.P.H. Everyone was nice and even though it started out gloomy the sun came out and we had a great time. There are plenty of places to eat and lots of things to... read more
We went whale and dolphin watching from here. It was a once in a lifetime experience! Saw dozens of dolphins and several humpback whales very close to the boat. We also ate at the... read more
The marina is a wonderful place for a stroll or a short run; almost completely flat with water views every way you look. Minimal traffic and beautiful boats, paddle boards and... read more
Dana Point Harbor is a wonderful place for strolling, people watching, or grabbing a meal. The walk ways are wide, dog friendly and pleasant. There is a wide variety of dining... read more
Nice walk and shopping and views. Liked the history of the area and statue of Dana, author of Two Years Before the Mast.
Baby Beach is local to me so I may be a bit biased. During the summer months arrive early to get a parking spot close enough to cart your gear to the beach. It does get crowded on... read more
This was a nice trip for children with the Christmas lights at the harbor. I know it is off season but it is nice!
Liked watching boats and walking along harbour. Vending machines give ice and drinks along the way-cool!
First time visit to Dana Point Harbour. Has the most stunning views of the island whilst sitting at the marina just watching the world go by. Very popular for dog walkers, but... read more
The boats are spacious and nice. It was kinda rough but all in all it was beautiful and we saw dolphins out there swimming with the boat.
Something about this place helps slow things down for me. It's easy to walk and relax and appreciate the beauty of SoCal.
Nice area, lot's of great restaurants. Some nice areas to walk, including the beach and the wharf. We saw seals in the harbor, people wave boarding..
Greys, humpbacks and blues - all found in these waters off Dana Point. We hopped aboard with about two dozen others for a 90-minute cruise w Capt. Dave. After 40 minutes we... read more
There is so much to do here. Rent kayaks, it will take about an hour to kayak around the entire harbor area. Or just grab your beach chairs and relax on baby beach while the... read more
I love to hike the trail above the harbour, great views. Down on the harbour itself is a great beach sheltered from the open ocean great for kids.
Our walk of the marina was wonderful. It was a buzz with activity. You would get up close to the Pacific beautiful coast as you stroll the area. The stores and restaurants in... read more
Dana Point is easy to get to and had plenty of parking and shops. Whale watching was a good time and there were lots of Sea Lions on the rocks. This area is much more relaxed... read more
I live in a beach town and still loved visiting here. Beaches were clean and preserved. Did some local hikes and they were beautiful as well. Lots of restaurants and shopping.
We saw a pod of dolphins near the jetty last Sunday. There is such a great feeling on this walk path! Lots of owners and their furry friends out to enjoy the sunshine, the ocean... read more
Enjoyable harbor to walk around. If your'e staying closeby it's worth a visit. Spotted some dolphins swimming in the harbor on our last visit. They have standup paddle board... read more
Dana Point Harbor is a gorgeous facility with a scenic overlook that is easily walkable from the town. You need to be in condition to walk 1-2 miles but it is well worth it... read more
Amazing marina. Good places to walk, SUP inside the breakwater. Baby beach was tranquil and fun to watch everyone engaged in water sports.
We stayed at the blue lantern hotel (also reviewed) and went for a walk around the harbour. It was really interesting to see all the different boats and just sit watching them... read more
A beautiful place for a walk at sunset! Plenty of restaurants for lunch, brunch, and dinner. Parking can fill up quickly on the weekends, get there early.
Took photos there of outer engagement..... This was a wonderful place by the beach, and the sunsets were gorgeous that helped us take nice photos.
We crossed the bridge and parked by the boat harbor. It is a nice place to walk around and look at all the boats in this harbor. You can see a lot of birds on the walk.

Walking around the area, I found folks to be very pleasant in the lovey shops. The merchandise was unique and the waterfront docks were within view. The weather is near perfect in... read more
A beautiful place to spend the afternoon, Lunch or brunch and dinner, plenty of places to pick from, enjoy paddle boards, kayaks, Dana Point Marine Mammal center!
We stopped for lunch in Dana Point. It's a pretty and welcoming little coastal town. I'm not sure where we ate but we had a view of the breakwater and people on sailboats. VERY... read more

enrich_metadata.abstract: Burbank is a city in Los Angeles County in Southern California, United States, 12 miles (19 km) northwest of downtown Los Angeles. The population at the 2010 census was 103,340. Billed as the "Media Capital of the World" and only a few miles northeast of Hollywood, numerous media and entertainment companies are headquartered or have significant production facilities in Burbank, including The Walt Disney Company, Warner Bros. Entertainment, ABC Studios, ABC Family, Marvel Studios, Nickelodeon, NBC, and Insomniac Games. The city is also home to Bob Hope Airport. Burbank also holds a special place in aerospace history since Lockheed's Skunk Works in Burbank produced some of the most secret and technologically advanced airplanes, including the U-2 spy planes that uncovered the Soviet Union missile components in Cuba. Burbank consists of two distinct areas: a downtown, in the foothills of the Verdugo Mountains, and flatlands, at the east end of the San Fernando Valley. At one time, it was referred to as "Beautiful Downtown Burbank" on Laugh-In and The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson. The city was named after David Burbank, a New Hampshire-born dentist and entrepreneur.
